article_title: Mortimer Zuckerman: The Full-Time Scandal of Part-Time America
article_text:
There has been a distinctive odor of hype lately about the national jobs report for June. Most people will have the impression that the 288,000 jobs created last month were full-time. Not so.

The Obama administration and much of the media trumpeting the figure overlooked that the government numbers didn't distinguish between new part-time and full-time jobs. Full-time jobs last month plunged by 523,000, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. What has increased are part-time jobs. They soared by about 800,000 to more...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Mortimer Zuckerman writes that fewer than half of U.S. adults are working full time. Why? Slow growth and the perverse incentives of ObamaCare.
twitter.title: The Full-Time Scandal of Part-Time America

image.alt: The full-time scandal of part-time jobs in America

article_summary:
There has been a distinctive odor of hype lately about the national jobs report for June.
The Obama administration and much of the media trumpeting the figure overlooked that the government numbers didn't distinguish between new part-time and full-time jobs.
Full-time jobs last month plunged by 523,000, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
What has increased are part-time jobs.
Most people will have the impression that the 288,000 jobs created last month were full-time.
